name: Moses
what_did:
Moses led the Israelites out of slavery in Egypt, a journey called the Exodus.
He received the Ten Commandments from God on Mount Sinai.
He is a central figure in Judaism, and also important in Christianity and Islam.
why_matters:
Moses helped shape the moral and legal foundations of Western religions.
The story of the Exodus is one of freedom, faith, and leadership.
His teachings influenced how many people think about right and wrong.
